intro: Poecilocalyx setiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters in suitable conditions.
